import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
source.b089c4b9:
# Filling missing value by mode
df.country.fillna(value=df.country.value_counts().max(),inplace=True)
df.country.isnull().sum()
source.c1ea4929:
# Filling missing value by mean
df.agent.fillna(value=df.agent.mean(),inplace=True)
df.agent.isnull().sum()
source.85f7b42f:
# As data missing is in large number we have to drop this column
df.drop(columns="company",inplace=True)
source.2d329271:
#  Here we can use bfill method as null value are almost negligible
df.children.fillna(method="bfill",inplace=True)
source.fbbf9b5b:
# Which countries have the most passengers ?
df[['country','adults','children','babies','is_canceled','numberofpassengers']].groupby("country").count().nlargest(5,"numberofpassengers")
source.14727e3f:
# Find passenger who have the maximum ADR (Average Daily Rate)
df[df["adr"]==df["adr"].max()][["name","adr"]]
source.7b966168:
# Define the average of number of nights stayed.
df['total_stays_in_nights'] = df['stays_in_week_nights'] + df['stays_in_weekend_nights']
df['total_stays_in_nights'].mean().round(2)
source.2483c2bb:
# Define the people whom reserved a hotel with most number of babies and children
df['total_babies_and_children'] = df['babies'] + df['children']
df[['name','email','phone-number','credit_card','hotel','total_babies_and_children']].sort_values('total_babies_and_children',ascending=False).head()
source.3780f59e:
# Define the phone number of regions which had the most reservations
df["phone-code"] = df["phone-number"].apply(lambda code: code.split("-")[0])
df["phone-code"].value_counts().head(5).to_frame().reset_index().rename(columns={"index":"Code","phone-code":"Count"})
source.61bab320:
# Which first names have the most frequency of last name?
df['name'].apply(lambda last_name:last_name.split()[1]).value_counts().head().to_frame('value_counts').reset_index().rename(columns={'index':'last_name'})
